JobTitle: Assistant Manager - Merchant Marketing (12 Month Contract/Secondment)
JobFullDesc:
Reporting to the Senior Manager, AU/NZ Merchant Marketing, the Assistant Manager of AU/NZ Merchant Marketing will be responsible for supporting American Express Merchants in Australia and New Zealand with tailored marketing solutions, contributing to positive Merchant satisfaction and revenue growth for these merchants.  This involves driving the Amex Offers pipeline for Merchants with standalone and Multi-Merchant offers and activating new Merchants that join the Amex network with marketing and point of purchase material, as well as the creation and execution of Card Member communications associated with these campaigns.
More specifically the Assistant Manager, ANZ Merchant Marketing, will be responsible for:


Amex Offers – AU/NZ


Lead business development efforts to seek merchant funding from existing and new merchants to run Amex Offers on our platform


Run a sales pipeline including lead management, qualification and end to end execution.


Help develop and deliver bespoke sales pitches to Merchants.


Gather all data to set up campaigns, run them through internal processes right through to implementation.


Manage the reporting of campaigns back to Merchants.


Coverage and Activation


Partner with our Acquisition and Client Management teams to demonstrate the value of accepting American Express to prospective Merchants.


Lead the creation of custom Point of Purchase (POP) for relevant Merchants, with a focus on New Coverage


Card Member Communications


Create and execute Card Member communications (EDM and Social) promoting Multi-Merchant campaigns, solus Amex Offers for key Merchants and activations for newly accepting merchants.


Budget Management


Assist with the management of budgets


Process invoices for suppliers and merchants




Business development and sales experience managing a pipeline of merchants end to end, creating and progressing leads to wins.


Demonstrated account management experience, ideally within the payments or digital media space.


Demonstrated skill in building and leveraging relationships; a team player who can successfully influence across multiple business units within American Express.


Exceptional communication skills and the ability to deliver complex information to audiences with limited prior knowledge.


Excellent organisational skills with the ability to prioritise multiple tasks in a high energy environment.


Customer first mindset.


Degree qualification in a business-related discipline.


Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
